sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"攀登，上升"之意。
means: ascend ：正式用词，指不用手攀，一直上升直到相当高的地方。
climb ：普通用词，含义广泛，侧重运用手足费力地攀登或上升，也可指抽象事物。
mount ：书面用词，词义与ascend相近，强调连续不断地向上移动、攀登或上涨。指骑马时用mount。
creep ： 多指人或四足动物匍匐爬行，尤指偷偷地或不出声地缓慢向前爬行。也指植物的蔓延生长等。
climb ： 通常指用手或足爬上或爬下，也指飞机、日、月的上升，还可用作比喻。
crawl ： 指人或动物以身躯贴着地面缓慢地移动。

word_mean: 在飞行中，当发动机推力大于空气阻力，利用剩余的那部分推力做功，使航空器增加高度的飞行。

sentence.Network_en: In an embarrassing climb-down, the Home Secretary lifted the deportation threat.
sentence.Network_cn: 内务大臣尴尬地作出让步，解除了将其驱逐出境的威胁。

sentence.Network_en: She started once again on the steep upward climb.
sentence.Network_cn: 她又开始沿着陡峭的山路往上爬。

sentence.Network_en: The boys lifted up their legs, indicating they wanted to climb in.
sentence.Network_cn: 男孩们抬起腿，示意想要爬进来。

lj.lj_ly: his job soon had him climbing the walls.
lj.lj_ls: 他的工作很快使他感到无能为力。

jx.jx_en_mean: be facing a very difficult task
withdraw from a position taken up in argument or negotiation

lj.lj_ly: he was forced to climb down over the central package in the bill.
lj.lj_ls: 他被迫在议案的中心一揽子提议上作出让步。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English climban, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German klimmen, also to clay and cleave

entry.def: If you climb something such as a tree, mountain, or ladder, or climb up it, you move towards the top of it. If you climb down it, you move towards the bottom of it.

example.ex: Climbing the first hill took half an hour...
example.tran: 爬第一座小山花了半个钟头。

example.ex: He picked up his suitcase and climbed the stairs...
example.tran: 他拎起手提箱，爬上了楼梯。

entry.def: If you climb somewhere, you move there carefully, for example because you are moving into a small space or trying to avoid falling.

example.ex: The girls hurried outside, climbed into the car, and drove off...
example.tran: 姑娘们匆忙跑了出来，爬进汽车，然后开车走了。

example.ex: He must have climbed out of his cot...
example.tran: 他肯定是从婴儿床里爬出来的。

entry.tran: (飞机等)爬升，升高;(太阳)升高，上升
entry.def: When something such as an aeroplane climbs, it moves upwards to a higher position. When the sun climbs, it moves higher in the sky.

example.ex: The plane took off for LA, lost an engine as it climbed, and crashed just off the runway.
example.tran: 飞机起飞前往洛杉矶，在爬升过程中一台发动机熄火，刚飞离跑道就坠毁了。

entry.def: When something climbs, it increases in value or amount.

example.ex: The nation's unemployment rate has been climbing steadily since last June...
example.tran: 自去年6月以来，该国的失业率一直在不断上升。

example.ex: Prices have climbed by 21% since the beginning of the year...
example.tran: 年初以来，物价已经上涨了21%。

means.word_mean: 1. an upward slope or grade (as in a road);

sentences.sentence: "the car couldn't make it up the rise"

means.word_mean: 2. an event that involves rising to a higher point (as in altitude or temperature or intensity etc.)

sentences.sentence: "it was a difficult climb to the top"

means.word_mean: 1. go upward with gradual or continuous progress;

sentences.sentence: "Did you ever climb up the hill behind your house?"
"Sales were climbing after prices were lowered"
"The path climbed all the way to the top of the hill"
"This young man knows how to climb the social ladder"

means.word_mean: 6. increase in value or to a higher point;

sentences.sentence: "the value of our house rose sharply last year"

list.explanation: (由于失望、 焦急或忧虑而)举止失常

example.en: By the time the cops came I was about to climb the wall.
example.zh: 警察赶到的时候，我都快急得发疯了。

example.en: He was at home for only three days, then he began to go up the wall.
example.zh: 他在家里只呆了三天，后来就开始坐立不安了。

auth_sentence.content: This happens every time you climb in an airplane.
auth_sentence.res_content: This happens every time you climb in an airplane.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This happens every time you climb in an airplane.

auth_sentence.content: Each year we have been able to climb back.
auth_sentence.res_content: Each year we have been able to climb back.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Each year we have been able to climb back.

auth_sentence.content: He'd managed to climb out and alert rescuers.
auth_sentence.res_content: He'd managed to climb out and alert rescuers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He'd managed to climb out and alert rescuers.

Sentence.sentence: I spent my boyhood climbing trees on Streatham Common, South London.
In the book, we meet John Muir as a youth fearlessly climbing the roof of his house.
US gross domestic product has climbed back to pre-recession levels, meaning we're producing as much as before, only with 6% fewer workers.
If you climb to 10000 feet, stay at that height for a day or two.

means.word_mean: 要攀登到的地方或距离

sentences.en: There was a steep climb on the road out of town.
sentences.cn: 市外公路上有一处很陡的上坡路。

sentences.en: The minister's climb to power had taken 8 years.
sentences.cn: 这位部长花了八年的工夫攀升到权贵之尊。

jushi.english: We climbed higher that we might see the scenes better.
jushi.chinese: 我们又往高处爬,以便更好地观看景色。

jushi.english: The dollar has been climbing steadily all week.
jushi.chinese: 整个星期美元一直在稳步增值。

jushi.english: The slope is too steep for us to climb.
jushi.chinese: 这斜坡太陡了,我们爬不上去。
